captions.text:
What up fish tank people? Fishtanktv.com Dustin's
Fish Tanks. Brining it to you on a Friday.

I'm fired up Friday folks, I'm fired up. Was
supposed to go out to Keenland today. I was

actually rocking the green bowtie today, but
I got too cold. I didn't really feel like

going out. The wife couldn't get a sitter
for the kids. I'm here shooting a video for

you all. Oh shout out to my people at the
Paint Treatment Center. I know you guys are

going to buy the whole system. The pure voice
over IP platform, they actually watch this

channel and were checking it out and realized
that I'm a complete nut job outside of work.

You know you want the whole system, it's going
to be awesome, trust me. Here's what's going

on fish tank folks. I want to show you about
my pond here. I'm having a lot of fun. Watching

this thing turn back alive. Spring is here
and I just feel alive. The pond is coming

alive and I'm excited about it. I did a big
ole water change on it the other day and its

looking pretty good. I actually haven't turned
on the waterfall yet, I probably should do

that really soon to get the oxygen flowing
in here. With your ponds and with your tanks,

you have to do the big water changes. I got
some Parrots Feather that's coming it. This

stuff comes in so thick. Its just starting
now. I really like how it comes up. These

lilies are going to be completely awesome.
There was one goldfish left in here, I don't

know if he survive the winter and I don't
think that he didn't survive the cold, I think

he got eaten. That happens so, oh this is
tight. We are actually going to have a little

bloom action. I wanted to show this, I also
wanted to show the Dwarf Sag. It just lives

out here. Like right here how sweet is that?
Just Dwarf Sag, just chilling. I've shown

this before, but a lot of fun. You can see
how it runs along the back there. I don't

know if you guys can see how ... Let me point
it out here with this piece of drift wood

here. Yeah it goes along the back right here,
in through here, and underneath there. I'm

really liking it. There is another lily that
is coming up here. I love that. So, that's

what I'm doing. Now I had someone as me today,
as we walk back to the greenhouse, had somebody

ask me on the last loach video how I got into
fish tanks. I'll tell the story real quick

then I got to get back to family time. There
is the green house, absolutely loving it.

By the way this tree above it is looking really
sweet too. Beautiful time of year to be living

in Kentucky. Yeah well I got into tanks when
I was either 13 or 14. I remember being a

kid at about the age 5 or 6 and my dad had
a 10 gallon tank. I remember opening the door

for him as he busted through, holding the
entire 10 gallon tank as he was dumping all

the water out doing water changes. I might
have been under the age of 10 there, I was

young. Yeah I got into them. I remember one
day I was over my boy David Brindle's house.

He had a little 10 gallon tank with a box
filter in it and I remember just staring at.

He had a couple miscellaneous tetras, your
standard Noah's Ark tank, 2 of this species,

2 of that, 2 of the other. I was like "I have
to have that" and I was hooked. I got a 10

gallon tank. The one that we had, I don't
think it was set up at the time. It wasn't

set up, so I set it up. I went out and I got
5 goldfish. And of course I put in like 5

goldfish instantly into a 10 gallon tank and
like 3 of them died over the weekend because

I didn't know cycling, at all. Just kind of
put them in there. Had pink gravel, which

was always killer. Actually still have some
of this tank too, by the way. Had my old man

come down so, this is remnants of Dustin's,
one of my first tanks. You got your plastic

plants, you got your pink plant, you got your
blue gravel, you know just ten types of terrible.

Yeah so started out in a 10 gallon tank and
got the goldfish. I remember like it was yesterday

actually when I went out and bought a 29 gallon
tank. I was hustling it at 13, 14, 15 I had

a job so I had money and lived at home, obviously.
I had cash. Remember loading the 29 gallon

tank, went to Meyer's. I pulled it off the
shelf and just put it in the shopping cart

with my mom. I will never forget that day,
it was like the biggest tank ever for me,

so I was really really excited about that.
So I took that sucker home. Did black gravel

this time, classed it up. Used what they call
an under gravel filter, if you're still using

an under gravel filter please leave me a comment
I would like to know how they are working

out for you. I'm beyond that technology these
days. Yeah so I'm showing goldfish, I had

goldfish. Big massive goldfish and I had them
and I actually traded them to my buddy Jolly.

The trade is still under some controversy
because I traded him my gold fish for a Marineland

over the back overflow filter. Yeah he had
those goldfish in his pond for quite awhile.

And they ended up getting really really big
and sweet. Yeah so I'm trying to think. I

had a 10 gallon and a 29 gallon before I was
16. I lived at Pet Supplies Plus on 5th Avenue

in Finley, Ohio. I was there all the time
nagging them, bothering them. Bringing in

fish, trading fish, just always there everyday
after school. Riding my bike with bags of

fish to and from home, so yeah that was a
lot of fun. So I did that up until 16 and

on my 16th birthday I got a job there and
that's a longer story, so I'm going to hold

off on that story. So from 14-16 goldfish
bowl way way back, 10 gallon tank my dad did

100% water changes on. I remember using decloro
though, that was a big deal. Getting a job

at Pet Supplies Plus at 16. I want to show
this tank though. Its Steve's old tank actually,

obviously not looking as good as his, but
I want to show what's up with the new growth

right here. I had some Rotella that was just
floating, stuck it here into the sand substrate,

sand over dirt I should say. Obviously new
growth, new growth. This is what you want

to look for folks, because parts of your plants
might not look good, but if you got new growth

you're straight. See that's got new growth,
new growth there the green tops, I've added

no nutrients, I've done nothing. I just filled
this tank up, declored it and put the plants

in. Also I got this plant, and it doesn't
look too hot but I've never kept Mexican Oak

Leaf before so I got it in, just kind of just
playing with it now. It really responded well,

it came in looking really bad. And I've just
planted it in here and what I'm seeing that's

encouraging to me is the new growth along
the stem here, so that's good. You can certainly

see how it peeled back over there and whatever.
I'm going to try this plant out. Excited to

see how it responds and it's always fun to
try out new plants. That's what I'm doing.

Welcome new subscribers. I want to apologize
to the few of you that were going to be on

that conference call last night I literally
scheduled that thing and then I found out

my daughter had a singing recital at the exact
same time that I had scheduled it, so I had

to back off of that. So I will be rescheduling
that I will shoot you all out an email. Also

on Aquatic Jungles there is a link to AquaticJungleSupply.com
where I am selling some new odd spectrum food,

a couple T5 fixtures are available on there,
CO2 systems, basically stuff to run with your

planted tank, also some really cool gravel
that's like the perfect size. I'm excited

to be offering that, it's a separate site
from Aquatic Jungle, aquaticjunglesupply.com

you will have to check that out. Its one 's'
in the middle, not two although I'll probably

buy the other URL. Yeah that's what's going
on folks and yeah have fun! Everyone make

it a good weekend Species Sunday coming at
you, I might even hit you with tomorrow over
Bryan's house we'll see. Later!

title: How I Started Getting into Fishtanks. Early Ages of Dustin's Aquariums
